dt: {bc}to pierce, strike, or take with or as if with a spear
{bc}to catch (something, such as a baseball) with a sudden thrust of the arm
{bc}to jab (an opposing player) with the blade of one's stick

dt.t: All game, the Caps held, hooked, slashed, {wi}speared{/wi}, chopped, and bopped … the Rangers' European players.

dt: {bc}to ram (an opposing player) with one's helmet

dt.t: … defensive end Ben Davidson set off a sidelines-clearing scrum when he {wi}speared{/wi} Dawson from behind after he was down.

dt: {bc}to thrust at or wound something with or as if with a spear

shortdef: to pierce, strike, or take with or as if with a spear
to catch (something, such as a baseball) with a sudden thrust of the arm
to jab (an opposing player) with the blade of one's stick
